title: Corporate Governance Practices of Owlet Inc

content.text: The board of directors at Owlet Inc is comprised of experienced professionals from diverse backgrounds. The board consists of nine members, including the CEO, independent directors, and representatives from major investors. This composition ensures a balanced decision-making process and brings in a wide range of expertise to guide the company's strategic direction.

Owlet Inc has a comprehensive executive compensation program that aligns the interests of executives with the long-term success of the company. The compensation includes a mix of base salary, performance-based bonuses, equity-based incentives, and benefits. The structure is designed to incentivize performance and promote shareholder value creation. Owlet Inc also discloses executive compensation details in their annual reports, enhancing transparency.

The board of directors at Owlet Inc comprises a significant number of independent directors. This independence ensures that executive decisions are thoroughly evaluated and approved in the best interest of shareholders. Independent directors bring objectivity and unbiased perspectives to board discussions, mitigating potential conflicts of interest and enhancing overall governance.

Owlet Inc places importance on shareholder engagement and actively seeks input from shareholders. The company holds regular meetings, both physical and virtual, to keep shareholders informed about company performance, strategy, and governance matters. This practice fosters transparency and allows shareholders to directly participate in the decision-making processes.

Owlet Inc has a well-defined code of conduct and ethics that guides the behavior and actions of its employees, executives, and board members. The code emphasizes integrity, honesty, and accountability, setting the standard for ethical practices within the organization. This code helps maintain a culture of trust and ensures that all stakeholders are treated fairly.

Owlet Inc has established various committees to enhance governance effectiveness. These committees include an audit committee, compensation committee, and nominating and corporate governance committee. Each committee is composed of independent directors who oversee specific areas of corporate governance and ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards.

Owlet Inc has implemented a robust risk management framework to identify, assess, and mitigate potential risks. The board of directors, along with senior management, actively monitors and manages risks to protect the interests of shareholders. The risk management practices help ensure sustainable business growth and protect the company's reputation.

Owlet Inc maintains a high level of transparency through regular financial reporting and disclosures. The company adheres to established accounting principles and provides detailed financial statements, ensuring clarity and accuracy in financial reporting. Additionally, Owlet Inc publishes annual reports and proxies that provide comprehensive information about the company's performance and governance practices.
